text: [Music]
hi Michael nice to see you again welcome
to the enterprise video series we're
here today to talk about the cloud value
framework or the CBF can you tell us a
little bit more about what the cloud
value framework is all about yeah great
question so for a number of years we've
heard from customers that it's really
difficult to value the benefits of cloud
and so to that end based on hundreds of
business case engagements we've
conducted with customers we've come up
with a framework on how to think about
that and really it's in four different
dimensions of value the first is cost
savings
the second is staff productivity the
third is operational resilience and the
fourth is business agility cost savings
really is the TCO benefit from moving to
the cloud staff productivity is the FTE
productivity gained from reducing or
eliminating time spent on certain tasks
operational resilience is the benefit of
improved availability and security and
business agility is being able to
innovate more and respond faster to
customers interesting can you share
perhaps some some examples or some
anecdotes about how the cloud value
framework has shown customers realizing
business benefits from AWS great
question so on cost savings a
professional services firm estimated
that effects would be reduced by 15 to
20 percent and after they migrated to
AWS they saw effects actually reduced by
35 percent for staff productivity a
technology firm their SVP of platform
and services estimated that 60% of her
team's time was being spent on
undifferentiated tasks and now after
migration that team's time is able to be
dedicated to more differentiated work
for operational resilience a healthcare
company rebuilt its patient engagement
platform on AWS and they were able to
reduce their monthly unplanned downtime
from 200 minutes down to less than 5
minutes in addition their page down load
times went from fifteen hundred
milliseconds down to 120 milliseconds
and for business agility an insurance
company measure the IT expenditure
dedicated to innovation and saw that
that one from 20% to over 60% with a DES
yes great so these are definitely issues
that all of our customers see on a daily
basis so thank you so much for the time
and as parting thoughts do you have any
any statements or any thing you would
like to share with the audience about
the cloud values Ramar yeah great
question so I would say number one
customers that have realized the most
value have PMO's and or Cloud Centers of
Excellence to help them ensure maximum
value realization the second is that
these companies build business cases
before migration ascribe value to
difficult to quantify areas and track
those metrics over time and lastly in
building those business cases they build
them before migration and involving
stakeholders from the business that's
really how customers realize the most
value out of AWS great thank you so much
for your participation really appreciate
your time thank you
[Music]
